Title:
Fomitopsis roseoalba (Agaricomycetes, Polyporales), a new
species, Fomitopsis betulina, a new combination, and Fomitospis sensu
stricto, a re-evaluation, based on morphological and molecular
characteristics
Abstract:
Fomitopsis roseoalba sp. nov. is described as a new
species from the Brazilian Amazonia based on morphological and molecular
analyses. The species is characterized by white to pink, resupinate,
effused-reflexed to pileate basidiomata, round to angular pores (4â“6
per mm), and ellipsoid to subcylindrical basidiospores (3â“4 Ã 1.8â“2.0
Î¼m). Phylogenetic analyses based on combined nuc rDNA ITS1-5.8S-ITS2
(ITS) and partial nuc 28S rDNA D1-D2 domains (28S) sequences show that
the new species, as well as Antrodia wangii and Piptoporus betulinus
(Bull.) P. Karst., belong in the Fomitopsis sensu stricto group within
the Antrodia clade, and the combination Fomitopsis betulina comb. nov.
is proposed. Description and illustration of the new species, and a key
to the species of Fomitopsis reported to Neotropics are provided.
